subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{liushu|p}}: an ancient vase used in making and storing fermented millet alcoholic drink. See [[酒]].

subSections.title: Definitions
subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# an [[alcoholic]] drink [[vessel]]
# tenth of twelve [[earthly branch]]es ([[十二支]])
# [[rooster]] ([[鷄]]) of [[W:Chinese zodiac|Chinese zodiac]]
# the period from 5-7 p.m.
# {{lb|zh|mathematics}} [[unitary]]

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: Although it remains associated with alcoholic drink, the character alone is mostly used as the tenth earthly branch in the Chinese cyclical calendar.

subSections.title: Compounds
subSections.text: {{zh-der|三酉|卯酉|卯酉參辰|卯酉子午|參辰卯酉|子午卯酉|才貫二酉|書畫卯酉|書通二酉|酉字牌|酉時|酉陽雜俎|鬼酉上車|酉群}}
